required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: In Vivo Preoperative Skin Preparation Persistence Evaluation
clinical_study.official_title: 96-hour Antimicrobial Persistence Assessment Following Exposure to Saline and Blotting

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate persistent antimicrobial effectiveness of chlorhexidine gluconate containing products on abdominal and inguinal sites following a saline and wipe challenge.

detailed_description.textblock: Persistent antimicrobial effectiveness was evaluated by measuring the regrowth of normal skin flora at 48 hours, 72 hours and 96 hours, and the suppression of regrowth relative to post-prep (10-min) at 48 hours, 72 hours and 96 hours.

primary_outcome.measure: Measurement of Skin Flora Recovery Post-prep Application
primary_outcome.description: The primary measure of persistence is the suppression of regrowth recovery relative to baseline (log10 CFU/cm^2) of skin flora at 3 defined post-treatment sampling times.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Skin Flora Relative to 10 Minutes Post-prep Application
secondary_outcome.description: Log10 CFU/cm^2 regrowth of skin flora, relative to 10-minute post-treatment log10 CFU/cm^2, at 3 defined post-treatment sampling times.

other_outcome.measure: Safety Outcome Evaluated by Skin Irritation (Dryness, Edema, Erythema, Rash) Assessment
other_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline (pre-treatment) and 10 minutes post-treatment, 48 hours post-treatment, 72 hours post-treatment, 96 hours post-treatment
other_outcome.description: Skin irritation (dryness, edema, erythema, rash) assessed on the test sites using a 0-3 rating scale: 0=no reaction, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe.

clinical_study.condition: Bacterial Recovery of Skin Flora Post-product Application

arm_group.description: Apply topically for 30 seconds (abdominal site) or 2 minutes (inguinal site), and allow to dry for 3 minutes.
Apply topically for 30 seconds (abdominal site) or 2 minutes (inguinal site), and allow to dry for 3 minutes.

intervention.description: Apply topically to intact dry skin (abdominal site) for 30 seconds or moist skin (inguinal site) for 2 minutes.
Apply topically to intact dry skin (abdominal site) for 30 seconds or moist skin (inguinal site) for 2 minutes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects of any race
- Subjects in good health
- Minimum skin flora baseline requirements on abdomen and groin
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any tattoos, scars, breaks in the skin, or any form of dermatitis, or other skin disorders (including acne) on the applicable test area
- Topical antimicrobial exposure within 14 days prior to screening and treatment days
- Use of systemic or topical antibiotics, steroid medications, or any other products known to affect the normal microbial flora of the skin within 14 days prior to screening and treatment days

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This is a randomized, paired-comparisons design where each subject will receive two of the planned treatments, one on the left side of body and one on the right. Each subject provides 2 abdomen test sites, left or right, and 2 inguen test sites, left or right. Therefore 69 subjects provide 276 potential test sites.

group.title: 3M CHG/IPA Prep/Abdominal Region
group.description: Experimental CHG/IPA prep was randomly assigned to the left or right side of the abdominal test site

group.title: ChloraPrep/Abdominal Region
group.description: Active comparator CHG/IPA prep was randomly assigned to the left or right side of the abdominal test sites

group.title: 3M CHG/IPA Prep/Inguinal Region
group.description: Experimental CHG/IPA prep was randomly assigned to the left or right side of the inguinal test site

group.title: ChloraPrep/Inguinal Region
group.description: Active comparator prep was randomly assigned to the left or right side of the inguinal test site

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Did not meet treatment day baseline

baseline.population: Subjects with average treatment day baseline counts of greater than or equal to 3.00 log10 CFU/cm2 bilaterally on the abdominal region and/or greater than or equal to 5.00 log10 CFU/cm2 bilaterally on the inguinal region were included in the analysis. 69 subjects provided 276 baseline test sites (69 rt abd, 69 lt abd, 69 rt ing, 69 lt ing).

group.title: 3M CHG/IPA/Abdominal Region
group.description: Investigational CHG/IPA Prep randomly assigned to the left or right abdominal region test sites

group.title: ChloraPrep/Abdominal Region
group.description: Active marketed comparator CHG/IPA Prep randomly assigned to the left or right abdominal region test sites

group.title: 3M CHG/IPA/Inguinal Region
group.description: Investigational CHG/IPA Prep randomly assigned to the left or right inguiinal region test sites

group.title: ChloraPrep/Inguinal Region
group.description: Active marketed comparator CHG/IPA Prep randomly assigned to the left or right abdominal region test sites

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Subjects meeting treatment day baseline requirement
measure.description: Treatment day baseline requirement is defined as greater than or equal to 3.00 log10 CFU/cm^2 bilaterally on the abdomen test site and/or greater than or equal to 5.00 log10 CFU/cm^2 bilaterally on the inguinal test site.

outcome.title: Measurement of Skin Flora Recovery Post-prep Application
outcome.description: The primary measure of persistence is the suppression of regrowth recovery relative to baseline (log10 CFU/cm^2) of skin flora at 3 defined post-treatment sampling times.
outcome.population: The primary analysis data set used a Modified Intent to Treat population. Subjects were excluded who did not meet the treatment day baseline requirements of either > or equal to 3.0 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the abdomen test site or > or equal to 5.0 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the inguinal test site.

group.title: Experimental Prep - Abdominal Site
group.description: Following baseline sample collection participants had 3M CHG/IPA Prep applied to their abdominal test site for 30 seconds and dry for 3 minutes.

group.title: Active Comparator Prep - Abdominal Site
group.description: Following baseline sample collection participants had ChloraPrep applied to their abdominal test site for 30 seconds and dry for 3 minutes.

group.title: Experimental Prep - Inguinal Site
group.description: Following baseline sample collection participants had 3M CHG/IPA Prep applied to their inguinal test site for 2 minutes and dry for 3 minutes.

group.title: Active Comparator Prep - Inguinal Site
group.description: Following baseline sample collection participants had ChloraPrep applied to their inguinal test site for 2 minutes and dry for 3 minutes.

measure.title: Measurement of Skin Flora Recovery Post-prep Application
measure.description: The primary measure of persistence is the suppression of regrowth recovery relative to baseline (log10 CFU/cm^2) of skin flora at 3 defined post-treatment sampling times.
measure.population: The primary analysis data set used a Modified Intent to Treat population. Subjects were excluded who did not meet the treatment day baseline requirements of either > or equal to 3.0 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the abdomen test site or > or equal to 5.0 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the inguinal test site.

analysis.groups_desc: 48-hours post-treatment time point. The primary analysis dataset used a modified Intent to Treat population. Subjects were excluded who did not meet the treatment day baseline requirements of greater than or equal to 3.0 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the abdomen. The null hypothesis is that there is no difference in log10 CFU /cm^2 recovery between arms at 48-hours post-treatment.

72-hours post-treatment time point. The primary analysis dataset used a modified Intent to Treat population. Subjects were excluded who did not meet the treatment day baseline requirements of greater than or equal to 3.0 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the abdomen. The null hypothesis is that there is no difference in log10 CFU /cm^2 recovery between arms at 72-hours post-treatment.

96-hours post-treatment time point. The primary analysis dataset used a modified Intent to Treat population. Subjects were excluded who did not meet the treatment day baseline requirements of greater than or equal to 3.0 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the abdomen. The null hypothesis is that there is no difference in log10 CFU /cm^2 recovery between arms at 96-hours post-treatment.

48-hours post-treatment time point. The primary analysis dataset used a modified Intent to Treat population. Subjects were excluded who did not meet the treatment day baseline requirements of greater than or equal to 5.0 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the inguinal. The null hypothesis is that there is no difference in log10 CFU /cm^2 recovery between arms at 48-hours post-treatment.

72-hours post-treatment time point. The primary analysis dataset used a modified Intent to Treat population. Subjects were excluded who did not meet the treatment day baseline requirements of greater than or equal to 5.0 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the inguinal. The null hypothesis is that there is no difference in log10 CFU /cm^2 recovery between arms at 72-hours post-treatment.

96-hours post-treatment time point. The primary analysis dataset used a modified Intent to Treat population. Subjects were excluded who did not meet the treatment day baseline requirements of greater than or equal to 5.0 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the inguinal. The null hypothesis is that there is no difference in log10 CFU /cm^2 recovery between arms at 96-hours post-treatment.

outcome.title: Change in Skin Flora Relative to 10 Minutes Post-prep Application
outcome.description: Log10 CFU/cm^2 regrowth of skin flora, relative to 10-minute post-treatment log10 CFU/cm^2, at 3 defined post-treatment sampling times.
outcome.population: The secondary analysis data set used a Modified Intent to Treat population. Subjects were excluded who did not meet the treatment day baseline requirements of either > or equal to 3.0 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the abdomen test site or 5.0 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the inguinal test

group.title: Experimental Prep - Abdominal Site
group.description: Following baseline sample collection participants had 3M CHG/IPA Prep applied to their abdominal test site for 30 seconds and dry for 3 minutes.

group.title: Active Comparator Prep - Abdominal Site
group.description: Following baseline sample collection participants had ChloraPrep applied to their abdominal test site for 30 seconds and dry for 3 minutes.

group.title: Experimental Prep - Inguinal Site
group.description: Following baseline sample collection participants had 3M CHG/IPA Prep applied to their inguinal test site for 2 minutes and dry for 3 minutes.

group.title: Active Comparator Prep - Inguinal Site
group.description: Following baseline sample collection participants had ChloraPrep applied to their inguinal test site for 2 minutes and dry for 3 minutes.

measure.title: Change in Skin Flora Relative to 10 Minutes Post-prep Application
measure.description: Log10 CFU/cm^2 regrowth of skin flora, relative to 10-minute post-treatment log10 CFU/cm^2, at 3 defined post-treatment sampling times.
measure.population: The secondary analysis data set used a Modified Intent to Treat population. Subjects were excluded who did not meet the treatment day baseline requirements of either > or equal to 3.0 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the abdomen test site or 5.0 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the inguinal test

analysis.groups_desc: 48-hours post-treatment time point. The primary analysis dataset used a modified Intent to Treat population. Subjects were excluded who did not meet the treatment day baseline requirements of greater than or equal to 3.0 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the abdomen. The null hypothesis is that there is no difference in log10 CFU /cm^2 regrowth from the 10 minute time point between arms at 48-hours post-treatment.

72-hours post-treatment time point. The primary analysis dataset used a modified Intent to Treat population. Subjects were excluded who did not meet the treatment day baseline requirements of greater than or equal to 3.0 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the abdomen. The null hypothesis is that there is no difference in log10 CFU /cm^2 regrowth from the 10 minute time point between arms at 72-hours post-treatment.

96-hours post-treatment time point. The primary analysis dataset used a modified Intent to Treat population. Subjects were excluded who did not meet the treatment day baseline requirements of greater than or equal to 3.0 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the abdomen. The null hypothesis is that there is no difference in log10 CFU /cm^2 regrowth from the 10 minute time point between arms at 96-hours post-treatment.

48-hours post-treatment time point. The primary analysis dataset used a modified Intent to Treat population. Subjects were excluded who did not meet the treatment day baseline requirements of greater than or equal to 5.0 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the inguinal. The null hypothesis is that there is no difference in log10 CFU /cm^2 regrowth from the 10 minute time point between arms at 48-hours post-treatment.

72-hours post-treatment time point. The primary analysis dataset used a modified Intent to Treat population. Subjects were excluded who did not meet the treatment day baseline requirements of greater than or equal to 5.0 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the inguinal. The null hypothesis is that there is no difference in log10 CFU /cm^2 regrowth from the 10 minute time point between arms at 72-hours post-treatment.
analysis.p_value_desc: Using a Hochberg Step-up procedure the critical p value is 0.17

analysis.groups_desc: 96-hours post-treatment time point. The primary analysis dataset used a modified Intent to Treat population. Subjects were excluded who did not meet the treatment day baseline requirements of greater than or equal to 5.0 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the inguinal. The null hypothesis is that there is no difference in log10 CFU /cm^2 regrowth from the 10 minute time point between arms at 96-hours post-treatment.

outcome.title: Safety Outcome Evaluated by Skin Irritation (Dryness, Edema, Erythema, Rash) Assessment
outcome.description: Skin irritation (dryness, edema, erythema, rash) assessed on the test sites using a 0-3 rating scale: 0=no reaction, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe.
outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline (pre-treatment) and 10 minutes post-treatment, 48 hours post-treatment, 72 hours post-treatment, 96 hours post-treatment
outcome.population: Subjects meeting required baseline counts: greater or equal to 3.00 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the abdominal region and greater than or or equal to 5.00 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the inguinal region.

group.title: 3M CHG/IPA Prep Abdominal Region
group.description: Chlorhexidine gluconate (CHG) 2% / Isopropyl alcohol 70% (IPA)

group.title: ChloraPrep CHG/IPA Abdominal Region
group.description: Chlorhexidine gluconate (CHG) 2% / Isopropyl alcohol (IPA) 70%

group.title: 3M CHG/IPA Prep Inguinal Region
group.description: Chlorhexidine gluconate (CHG) 2% / Isopropyl alcohol (IPA) 70%

group.title: ChloraPrep CHG/IPA Inguinal Region
group.description: Chlorhexidine gluconate (CHG) 2% / Isopropyl alcohol (IPA) 70%

measure.title: Safety Outcome Evaluated by Skin Irritation (Dryness, Edema, Erythema, Rash) Assessment
measure.description: Skin irritation (dryness, edema, erythema, rash) assessed on the test sites using a 0-3 rating scale: 0=no reaction, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe.
measure.population: Subjects meeting required baseline counts: greater or equal to 3.00 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the abdominal region and greater than or or equal to 5.00 log10 CFU/cm^2 on the inguinal region.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected during the treatment phase of the study. Product remained on each subject's skin for approximately 96 hours.

group.description: Chlorhexidine gluconate (CHG) 2% / Isopropyl alcohol 70% (IPA)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
